complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Update Landing Page with New Pricing Plans and Features
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down the landing page update into: (1) PricingSection.tsx updates, (2) feature list corrections, (3) pricing calculator component creation, (4) hero section text update, (5) FAQ section update, (6) price history feature mention, (7) consistency checks and responsive design validation.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: This task involves multiple UI updates, a new pricing calculator component, and consistency checks across the landing page. While the changes are mostly isolated to the frontend and leverage existing components and design systems, the need for accuracy, responsive design, and thorough testing across all references increases complexity. The task is not algorithmically complex but requires careful coordination and validation, especially for the new calculator and ensuring all pricing references are updated.

complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Update Subscription Plans Configuration in Code
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Decompose the configuration update into: (1) Basic plan verification, (2) Pro plan updates (price, limits, additional fee), (3) Enterprise plan verification, (4) features array updates, (5) calculateProPlanCost function implementation, (6) integration and regression testing.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: This is a backend configuration and utility function update, mostly involving changes to a single module and related functions. The main complexity comes from ensuring all dependent functions and components work with the new configuration, and that pricing logic is correct and testable. The task is straightforward but requires careful regression testing to avoid breaking existing billing or plan logic.

complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Enforce Subscription Limits in Upload & Properties APIs
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Split the enforcement into: (1) middleware implementation for property/project limits, (2) integration with upload API, (3) integration with properties API, (4) error response formatting, (5) end-to-end testing for all plan scenarios.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: This task introduces new middleware and modifies critical API endpoints, requiring careful handling of business logic, error messaging, and integration with existing rate limiting and subscription logic. Ensuring backward compatibility and robust error handling adds to the complexity, as does the need for comprehensive testing across all plan types and edge cases.

complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Implement 14-Day Trial System
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Expand the trial system into: (1) database schema/migration, (2) trial status middleware, (3) trial expired page, (4) dashboard trial banner, (5) signup flow integration, (6) API/middleware integration, (7) comprehensive testing.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Implementing a trial system touches database schema, middleware, UI, and multiple integration points (signup, dashboard, APIs). It requires careful handling of state transitions, RLS policies, and user experience for both active and expired trials. The need for robust enforcement, seamless upgrade flows, and integration with payment systems increases both technical and testing complexity.

complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Implement Card-Required Signup Flow
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down the signup flow into: (1) onboarding pages, (2) database schema updates, (3) Stripe Checkout integration, (4) webhook event handling, (5) signup flow integration, (6) trial user experience updates, (7) email notification triggers, (8) end-to-end testing.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: This task requires orchestrating frontend onboarding, backend schema changes, payment provider integration (Stripe), webhook event handling, and seamless user experience for trial and paid users. The complexity is high due to the number of moving parts, external dependencies, and the need for robust error handling and state management across the signup and trial lifecycle.
